gram

In a test, Lorna got 9 points less than Maria. If Lorna got 85, what score did Maria get?
Lance bought 3 ballpens at ‚Ç±7.50 each and a pencil case for ‚Ç±22.50. How much did he pay for the purchase?
Rosa bought a bag of 50 candies. She gave 1/2 of the candies to her friends and 2/5 of the remaining to her sisters. How many candies remained with her?
An angle measures 42 degrees. How many degrees is its complement?
Ron has a rope 6 1/2m long. Tony has one that is 7 2/3. How long are the ropes together?

fig1.png
How many centimeters are equal to 3 3/5 meters?

Victoria bought 785cm of silk, 615cm of tetoron and 900cm of velvet. How many meters of cloth did she buy in all?
A school yard is 117m long and 103m wide. If you run around it 5 times, how many meters will that be?
Jack has a garden 12m long and 9m wide. He wants to fence it. If a meter of fencing costs ‚Ç±37.50, how much will it cost to fence his garden?
How many 3dm pieces of ribbon can be cut from a 10m ribbon?
Benilia earns ‚Ç±8,700.00 a month. She saves 1/10 of her salary. How much does she save in a month?
A vendor bought 130 big oranges at ‚Ç±24.50 each. He sold 122 at ‚Ç±35.00 each. The rest were spoiled. How much did he gain?
Greg has ‚Ç±81.00. Ricky has ‚Ç±36.00 less than twice the money of Greg. How much do they have altogether?
A square has a side of 18m. A rectangle has a length of 22m and a width of 16m. By how much is the area of the rectangle bigger than the area of the square?
What is the quotient when the sum of the first six even counting numbers is divided by 2?

Ann and Tom work part time at a mall. Ann works for 3 consecutive days then has a free day. Tom works for 5 consecutive days then has 2 consecutive days off. If both worked on January 1, when did they next work on the same day?
January 5

Lyn has red strips of cartolina, each 12cm long. Rose has blue strips of cartolina, each 14cm long. What is the least number of strips Lyn can lay beside the least number that Rose must lay so that their strips will be the same length? Give the answer only for Lyn.
Give two prime numbers whose sum is 32 and difference is 26.
29 and 3
Write the least 5-digit odd number using all the digits 0, 3, 7, 2, 5.
What is the sum of 3 1/4 and 2 1/2?
A 7m piece of ribbon is cut into 2 dm pieces. How many pieces would it have?
The sum of the measures of two angles of a triangle is 121‚Å∞. What is the third angle?
What is the value of 3‚Å¥ ‚Äì 4¬≥?
How many thousands are in 7.7 million?
A number multiplied by 9, then divided by 2 gives 72. What is the number?
Express 32 x 10¬≥ in standard notation.
Nina sold 5/8 of the 64 sampaguita garlands she made. How many were not sold?
What is three-halves of one-half?
Name two multiples of 15 that have a sum of 75.
30 and 45
In a 100-item test, JC answered 3/4 of the items correctly. RG answered 7/10 correctly and CJ answered 4/5 correctly. Who got the highest score and what did he get?
CJ, 80
In a class of 48 pupils, 1/3 are in the honor roll. Of this number, 1/4 are first honors. How many of the pupils in the honor roll are not first honors?
To decorate a stage, 37.5m of ribbon is cut into 15 pieces of equal lengths. How long is each piece?
A camera was sold for ‚Ç±1,800.00. The advertisement said this was 3/4 of its marked price. What was the marked price?
A staff needs 2 1/2 dm of ribbon for each certificate. How many meters of ribbon does she need to prepare 35 certificates?
A side of a square is 12cm. If each side is increased by 2cm, by how many square centimeters is the area increased?
The cross product of two equal ratios is 120. If one ratio is 4:15, what is the other ratio?
A dress is sold at a mall for ‚Ç±550.00. A retailer bought half a dozen of this type of dress at 3/4 the regular price. How much did she pay for the dresses?
A boy got scores of 84, 76, 85, 80, 90 in 5 tests. To get an average of 85, what must be his score in the 6th test?
A train left the station at 6:45 on Monday evening and traveled for 15 1/2 hours. What time and day did it arrive at its destination?
Tuesday, 10:15 a.m.
A rectangle has a perimeter of 44cm and an area of 112cm¬≤. What is its possible dimension?
14cm by 8cm
Square tiles with a side of 20cm cost ‚Ç±32.50 each. How much will the tiles for a floor that is 2.8m by 3.4 cost?
Three-fifths of a group of 300 pupils are boys. If 1/4 of the boys and 2/5 of the girls went outing, how many pupils went outing?
A six-digit number begins with 7 and is divisible by 9. All the digits are different. Find the smallest possible value of this number.
What is the largest three-digit number divisible by 4?
One factor of a number is 22. What can the other factor be so that the product is between 250 and 300?
If you skip count by 6 by saying 10 in the 1st number, 16 as the 2nd number and so on, what will you say as the 10th number?
The product of 36 and 45 is 1,620. By what number will you multiply 45 to get 162,000?
What is the least amount of squares that can be cut from a piece of paper 36cm by 48cm without any paper being wasted?
If 2/3 of a number is 42, what is twice the number?
If you save ‚Ç±5.00 on January 1, ‚Ç±10.00 on February 1, ‚Ç±15.00 on March 1 , and so on how much will you save on December 1?
Miss Lucy asked her pupils to open their book to the facing page numbers that add up to 165. What are the two page numbers?
82 and 83
Tom made a square garden 10m on each side. He fenced it with the posts 2m apart. How many posts did he use?
Which fraction is the smallest among 10/11, 11/12, 12/13,13/14?
6 2/3 is equal to how many 12ths?
1/5 of 90 is how much less than 2/3 of 72?
What is the remainder when 7,578 is divided by 49?
What is the smallest digit that can be used to fill the blank in 46,74_ so that it is divisible by 12?
Our assignment is on two different pages of a book. The difference between the numbers is 5 and the sum is 71. What are the numbers?
33 and 38
A flower shop had 20 bundles of roses with 18 in each bundle. The storekeeper made smaller bundles of 12 roses from them. How many bundles did he make?
If 3 apples cost ‚Ç±50.00 and three oranges cost ‚Ç±64.00, how much will a dozen of each fruit cost?
How many ten thousands are there in 10 billion?
A pair of shoes were bought for ‚Ç±450.00 at 60% discount. What is its regular price?
Roy is 5 years older than his sister. In 4 years‚Äô time, the sum of their ages will be 25. How old is Roy?
In a farm, there are pigs and chickens. Nina counted 27 heads and 78 legs. How many chickens are there?
When 8 is added to the numerator and denominator of 7/13, how much bigger is the resulting fraction?
The length of a rectangle is 6cm more than its width. If the perimeter is 60cm, what is the area of the rectangle?
Rina has 36-pesos in 25¬¢, 1-peso coins and 5-peso coins. How many 5-peso coins has she if she has 22 coins?
If you add 27 to my number, divide the result by 3 and add 45 you get 80. What is my number?
The average weight of 5 students is 41 kilograms. The weight of a 6th student is 50 kilograms. What is the average weight of the 6 students?
Jake and Ron have ‚Ç±1,592.00 together. Pat has ‚Ç±40.00 more than Jake. If Ron has ‚Ç±292.00 less than Jake, how much does Pat have?
If you add 28 to my number, divide the sum by 3 and then multiply the result by 4, you get 68. What is the number?
The base of an isosceles triangle is 6cm more than each leg. If the perimeter is 57cm, find the length of the base.
23 cm
Change 0.125 to a fraction in lowest terms.
In ùüî44,651, how many times as great is the bold ùüî as the 6 that is not bold?

If 3,254 x 63.58 = 3.254 x N, what is N?
By how much is 2‚Å∑ greater than 7¬≤?
The perimeter of a rectangle is 54cm. if the length is 3cm more than its width, what is the length?
15 cm
Three-sevenths of the 840 pupils of a school are boys and 2/3 of the boys are in primary grades. How many boys are there in the intermediate grades?
Ken finished 2/9 of a wall in 1 hour and 24 minutes. How long will it take him to finish the rest of the wall?
4 hours and 54 minutes
Thrice what number is the same as the sum of 456 and 624?
If May 16 is a Friday, what day is May 14?
Wednesday
Mario multiplied 3.45 x 6.35 on a calculator without putting the decimal points and got 219075. What is the correct answer?

Luz gave 276 cans of sardines to one group of flood victims. She gave 69 more cans to a second group than the first. She gave 38 fewer to a third group than to the first. How many cans of sardines did Luz give away?
A cube 12cm on each side contains 900cm¬≥ of water. How much more water is needed to fill it completely?
The scale of a plan of a house is 2cm to 3m. If a room is 7cm by 6cm on the plan, what is its actual area?
A hamburger sandwich and a softdrink cost ‚Ç±22.50. Two hamburger sandwiches and a softdrink cost ‚Ç±37.00. How much does a sandwich cost?
A box has 5dm by 4dm by 3dm internal measurements. Find the maximum number of pieces of soap 10cm by 6cm by 5cm that can be placed in it.
Tom bought a sound system. He paid ‚Ç±1,100.00 in cash and the rest with his credit card. If he paid 20% of the price of the sound system in cash, how much was the total price of the sound system?
Liza bought 9kg of crabs and 8kg of prawns. Each kilogram of prawns costs half as much as a kilogram of crabs. If each kilogram of prawns costs ‚Ç±300.00, how much did Liza spend in all?
On Wednesday, a bakery sold thrice as many buns as on Tuesday. On Thursday, it sold 100 more buns as on Wednesday. If the bakery sold 968 buns on the three days, how many did it sell on Thursday?
Tony had thrice as much money as Devi. Devi had ‚Ç±20.00 more than Pete. If the three persons had ‚Ç±380.00, how much did Pete have?
There are 160 white and pink roses, 180 pink and yellow roses, and 170 white and yellow roses. How many pink roses are there?
What number is 27 more than the difference of 95 and 36?
What digit can be placed on the blank in 563_ to make it divisible by 6?
What is the value of 5¬≥ - 6 x 8?
Find the smallest whole number to multiply to 60 to make it a perfect square?
The tens digit of a two-digit number is 5 more than the ones digit. If the number is 8 times the sum of its digit, find the number.
What is the 12th term in the pattern 10, 14, 18, 22, ...?
A 20dm log is to be cut into 10 equal pieces. If each cut takes 3 minutes, how long will it take to make the 10 pieces?
27 minutes
Rina uses 2/3 of a cup of oats per serving of oatmeal. How many cups of oats does she need for 6 servings?
One hundred is multiplied by a number between 0 and 1. The answer is between what two whole numbers?
0 and 100
What is 4.8 x 10¬≥?
Express the LCM of 10 and 15 as products of its prime factors.
2 x 3 x 5
The ratio of two numbers is 5:7. If the bigger number is 91, what is the smaller number?
1/2 + 3/4 + 7/8 + 15/16 is equal to what improper fraction in lowest terms?
How many pieces of string 4.2dm long can be cut from a roll of 30m string?
What is the perimeter of a table formed by placing 7 square tables of side 1 1/2m end to end?
It takes one man one day to dig a 2m by 2m by 2m hole. How long will it take 3 men working at the same rate to dig a 4m by 4m by 4m hole?
4/3 days
Find two numbers with a sum of 22 and a product of 112.
8 and 14
Change 3.325 to an improper fraction in lowest terms.
If 48 is added to one-third of a number, the results is thrice the number. What is the number?
What number multiplied by itself is equal to the product of 32 and 162?
What is the 50th number in the pattern 4, 7, 10, 13, ...?
When I open my mathematics book, the sum of two pages facing me is 317. What is the number of the very next page?
The width of a rectangular garden is 3m less than the length. If the perimeter is 84m, what is the length?
Five oranges and one apple cost ‚Ç±66.00. One orange and five apples cost ‚Ç±54.00. How much does an orange cost?
The average weight of Joe and Ben is 50 2/3 kg. If the weight of Joe is 54 1/2kg, what is the weight of Ben?
The quotient of two numbers is four and their difference is 39. Find the smaller one.

Rina went to a store where she spent half her money and ‚Ç±14.00. She went to a second store where she spent one-third of her remaining money and ‚Ç±14.00 more. She had no money left. How much had she at first?
